intro: Pilosella setosopetiolata, commonly known as the hairy-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy textures. Pilosella setosopetiolata typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
